title: Australia news live: Cash accuses PM of ‘double standards’ over trip to UK Labour conference; police investigate fatal plane crash
summary: For real-time updates on today's news, tune in to live coverage. Stay informed about the latest developments across various topics. Keep an eye on breaking stories as they unfold.

title: What would you do if a supermarket accidentally gave you £300 of groceries you hadn’t paid for? | Polly Hudson
summary: The law encourages individuals to return lost items. However, many might feel tempted to keep them instead. This raises ethical questions about the moral responsibilities associated with lost property.

title: ‘Huge energy challenges’: how can India make the leap to become a green, clean country?
summary: Increasingly frequent deadly heatwaves in India are heightening the demand for life-saving cooling solutions. This surge in demand is putting additional pressure on the country's power generation capacity. The situation highlights the urgent need for enhanced energy resources to address climate-related challenges.

title: Ukraine war briefing: Ukraine discussing ‘mega’ arms deal with US, Zelenskyy says
summary: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy announced efforts to negotiate a drone sales agreement with the United States. Meanwhile, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov warned the UN that any aggression toward Russia would be met with a strong response. Tensions remain high as both countries navigate their military capabilities and international relations.

title: Albanese rules out holding Australian republic referendum while he is prime minister
summary: The Prime Minister, who once supported transitioning to a republic, has shown a shift in stance and is now less focused on advocating for constitutional changes. This change in approach indicates a reconsideration of the importance of the republic discussion. The current emphasis appears to be shifting away from significant constitutional reforms.
